briefTitle: Aliskiren in Combination With Losartan Compared to Losartan on the Regression of Left Ventricular Hypertrophy in Overweight Patients With Essential Hypertension

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with essential hypertension
* Patients with a BMI \> 25 kg/m2
* Patients with LVH (LVWT â‰¥ 1.3 cm) confirmed by the ECHO

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients treated with an ACE or an ARB within 3 months of study entry (Study Visit 1) who are unable or unwilling to undergo the 3 month washout period.
* Patients treated with an ACE and ARB combination at study entry.
* Known secondary hypertension of any etiology (e.g., uncorrected renal artery stenosis).

Other protocol related inclusion/exclusion criteria applied to the study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Left Ventricular Mass Index (LVMI) From Baseline to End of Study (Week 36)
outcomeMeasures.description: Left ventricular mass index (LVMI) was measured by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). An increase in LVMI indicates hypertrophy of the left ventricle. This could be a normal reversible response to cardiovascular conditioning (athletic heart) or an abnormal irreversible response to chronically increased volume load (preload) or increased pressure load (afterload). Thickening of the ventricular muscle results in increased left ventricular pressure, increased end-systolic volume, and decreased end-diastolic volume, causing an overall reduction in cardiac output.

Change From Baseline in Mean 24-hour Ambulatory Diastolic and Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to the End of the Study (Week 36)
outcomeMeasures.description: Two 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM) evaluations were performed, one at baseline and one at the end of the study. For each evaluation, the ABPM device was attached to the non-dominant arm of the patient. A correlation was made between the ABPM device readings and measurements taken with a mercury sphygmomanometer and stethoscope. Following the correlation procedure, blood pressure was measured at study specified intervals.
